intro: Pedicularis pectinata var. pyramidata, commonly known as the pyramid bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. Its flowers typically bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
